alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 9:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central West Virginia, including the following county, Calhoun. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arnoldsburg, Orma, Millstone and Nicut. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
